text: our success with the AWS infrastructure
can be attributed to the scalability
elasticity Global availability of the
service as well as the key focus on
velocity from AWS development team my
name is Eva say I manage the Big Data
platform team at Netflix Netflix is a
global destination for people to enjoy
great movies and TV shows our goals is
that you will always find something that
you enjoy to watch on Netflix
we are located in Northern California
the city of lascad we have over 2,000
employees all of which 2third have
technical roles and Netflix is largely
technology-driven and Technology focused
company so in 2009 we knew we would be
attempting to build a global internet
television service one day and we were
in a Data Center and at that time we
were thinking about moving to AWS Cloud
already so it just makes sense for the
Big Data platform team to be the first
one to lean forward and build it from
the cloud right from the beginning we
have tens of thousands of instances
running across three different regions
in
AWS um we have hundreds of microservices
we serve hundreds of thousands of
requests per second and we serve over 1
billion hours of content per month and
all of these are running out of AWS
infrastructure as we move to the cloud
our engineering organization has also
moved to more devops oriented combine
that with the Netflix culture of freedom
and responsibility our developers or
Engineers can actually have the freedom
and use the judgment to spin up
instances to do tests and experiments at
any time it only takes seconds or maybe
minutes to spin up new instances or new
Amazon services for the tests versus in
the past
they would have to talk to it and it
would take maybe days or weeks for those
Hardwares to be procure a service like
Netflix elasticity and scalability is
extremely important so having a service
like AWS Cloud that could expand and
Shrink its footprint based on traffic is
really important for us and also we're
continuously to grow our customer base
we'll get more and more customer we just
need a service that has the capacity
that we could grow into to support many
more users than today our users just now
take it for granted they expect that
when they turn on the Netflix service it
would just work and part of it is
attributed for the fact that we are now
on AWS cloud
